title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO Live: BCCL listing date postponed to Jan 19 instead of Jan 16 due to BMC Election results
author: Moneycontrol News
content:

The listing of Bharat Coking Coal's shares has been deferred to January 19 as domestic equity markets will be shut on Thursday, January 15, owing to municipal corporation elections in Maharashtra, CNBC-TV18 reported.

Bharat Coking Coal share listing postponed to January 19, reports CNBC-TV-18

Bharat Coking Coal share listing has been postponed to January 19 on account of civic elections in Mumbai. (Read More)

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: Lower-priced IPOs attract heavy subscriptions

Recent IPOs priced at relatively lower levels have also seen robust demand. Issues such as Belrise Industries, Groww and Meesho witnessed heavy oversubscription, ranging from about 18 times to as high as 82 times, underscoring strong investor appetite for attractively priced offerings.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: Large retail participation in PSU stocks

Several PSU companies enjoy a wide retail shareholder base. Coal India and IREDA have close to 28 lakh retail shareholders each, while State Bank of India has around 37 lakh public shareholders despite being majority-owned by the Government of India. In comparison, private sector lenders such as ICICI Bank and HDFC Bank have about 21 lakh and 36 lakh public shareholders, respectively.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: Strong past response to PSU IPOs

Investor interest in PSU offerings has been strong in recent years. For example, Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA) launched its IPO in November 2023 at a price band of Rs 30 to Rs 32. The issue was subscribed nearly 39 times, with the stock listing at around Rs 50 per share, a premium of about 56 per cent, and it currently trades near Rs 138.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: Attractive pricing makes IPO accessible to retail investors

The Bharat Coking Coal IPO, priced in the range of Rs 21 to Rs 23 per share, appears attractively valued, making it affordable even for small retail investors. The company's status as a public sector undertaking backed by Coal India further adds to its appeal, as PSU stocks are often preferred for their perceived stability, government support and consistent dividend payouts.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: Global and domestic investors participate in IPO anchor round

A combination of global and domestic institutional investors participated in the company's IPO anchor round. Key participants included Life Insurance Corporation, Societe Generale, Copthall Mauritius Investment Ltd, Citrine Fund, M7 Global Fund PCC - ASAS Global Opportunities Fund, Maybank Securities and Rajasthan Global Securities. Of the total anchor allocation, 7.17 crore shares were allotted to three domestic mutual funds across eight schemes.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: How to check Bharat Coking Coal IPO allotment status online on BSE

To check the allotment status of Bharat Coking Coal IPO on BSE:

Visit the BSE allotment status page: https://bseindia.com/investors/appli_check.aspx

Select Equity as the issue type

Choose Bharat Coking Coal Ltd from the list of issue names

Enter your PAN details or IPO application number

Click Search to view the allotment status

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: Check Bharat Coking Coal IPO allotment status online on NSE

To check the allotment status of Bharat Coking Coal IPO on NSE:

Visit NSE's IPO status page: https://www.nseindia.com/invest/check-trades-bids-verify-ipo-bids

Select Equity & SME IPO bid details

Choose Bharat Coking Coal Ltd under the symbol BHARATCOAL

Enter your PAN card details and application number

Click Submit to view your allotment status

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: Bharat Coking Coal dominates India's coking coal production

Bharat Coking Coal Limited is India's largest coking coal producer, contributing approximately 58.5 per cent of the country's domestic output in FY25. The company is a wholly owned subsidiary of Coal India Limited and holds estimated coal reserves of around 7,910 million tonnes.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: Bharat Coking Coal emerges as India's largest coking coal producer in FY25

Bharat Coking Coal was India's top coking coal producer in fiscal 2025, according to a Crisil report. The company supplies multiple grades of raw coking and non-coking coal, along with washed coal and by-products, primarily serving the steel, power, and cement sectors. Since its establishment in 1972, Bharat Coking Coal has steadily expanded operations, with production rising from 30.51 million tonnes in FY22 to 40.50 million tonnes in FY25, a 32.74 per cent increase. Financially, the company recorded revenue of Rs 13,802 crore and a profit of Rs 1,204 crore in FY25.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: Canara Bank Securities maintains optimistic outlook on Bharat Coking Coal IPO

Canara Bank Securities highlighted that Bharat Coking Coal's strong ties with Coal India, a robust steel sector, and solid fundamentals support a positive outlook on the company. The brokerage, however, noted seasonal risks, pointing out that heavy rainfall in the Dhanbad region affected performance in the first half of the year. Despite these challenges, Canara Bank Securities has recommended investors with a medium-to-high risk appetite to "Subscribe" to the IPO, emphasizing a long-term investment perspective.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: BCCL IPO allotment status: How to check online

The Bharat Coking Coal Limited (BCCL) IPO allotment status will be available on the KFin Technologies Limited website on January 14, 2026. Investors can check their allotment status by following these steps:

Visit the official website of KFin Technologies Limited.

Select "Bharat Coking Coal Limited" from the dropdown menu.

Choose any one option-PAN, application number, or DP/Client ID.

Enter the required details to verify your identity.

Click on "Search" to view your IPO allotment status.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: Key factors to watch out

Reserves and dominance: BCCL holds 7.91 billion tonnes of coal reserves, accounting for a significant 58.5% share of India's domestic coking coal.

Growth: Coal production rose steadily from 30.51 million tonnes in FY2022 to 40.50 million tonnes in FY2025.

Strategic importance: The company plays a critical role in reducing India's dependence on imported coking coal for the steel industry.

PSU backing: Strong parentage from Coal India provides BCCL with operational strength and key regulatory support.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: BCCL operations, market position and growth plans

BCCL is India's leading producer of prime coking coal, a critical input for steel manufacturing. The company is engaged in the mining of raw coking and non-coking coal, supported by coal washing operations through five washeries with a combined capacity of 13.65 MTPA.

In FY2025, BCCL recorded raw coal offtake of 38.26 million tonnes, with the power sector emerging as its largest consumer, accounting for 77.61 percent of total offtake. The company also holds the largest coking coal washery capacity in the country, playing a key role in supporting India's steel capacity expansion target of 300 million tonnes by FY2031.

Looking ahead, BCCL plans to add new washeries, revive underground mines through the MDO mode, and explore coal-bed methane projects as part of its long-term growth and sustainability initiatives.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: BCCL IPO structure and key details

The BCCL IPO is a book-built issue and is entirely structured as an Offer for Sale (OFS). The issue size stands at Rs 1,071.11 crore, with the company's shares proposed to be listed on both the BSE and NSE. The issue is being managed by IDBI Capital Markets & Securities Limited and ICICI Securities Limited as lead managers, while KFin Technologies Limited has been appointed as the registrar to the issue.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: Subscription and grey market trends

The Coal India arm saw exceptional demand, with the issue getting fully subscribed within minutes of opening and closing with nearly 147 times subscription on the final day, as per NSE data. Strong interest was also reflected in the grey market, where the shares traded at a premium of around 43-45 percent, with market trackers indicating a grey market premium of about Rs 10.3 per share and a potential listing gain of nearly 45 percent.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: Lot size and retail investment

Investors were required to bid for a minimum lot of 600 shares, implying a minimum investment of Rs 13,800 for retail investors at the upper end of the price band.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: Price band and valuation

The price band for the issue was fixed at Rs 21 to Rs 23 per share, valuing Bharat Coking Coal at over Rs 10,700 crore at the upper end of the band.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: Issue size and structure

The IPO, which opened for subscription on January 9 and closed on January 13, 2026, is a book-built issue valued at Rs 1,071.11 crore. The public offering is entirely an Offer for Sale (OFS) and comprises 46.57 crore equity shares.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO Allotment Live: Allotment and listing timeline

The allotment for the Bharat Coking Coal Ltd (BCCL) IPO is set to be finalised on January 14, 2026, while the company's shares are expected to debut on the BSE and NSE on January 16, 2026.
